CAPTION FIG1.png: 'Figure 1: _Single-molecule imaging of actin binding to actin filaments. \\(\\langle\\Delta\\rangle\\) Schematic drawing of an actin filament tethered to the surface of a streptavidin-conjugated coverslip. \\(\\langle\\)B\\(\\rangle\\) Time-lapse images of fluorescently labeled actin found to an actin filament (cofilin, green; actin, red. The changes in fluorescence intensity were measured within a circle (eliaenster, 520 nm) and analyzed. \\(\\langle\\)C\\(\\rangle\\) The distribution of the intensity of the cofilin fluorescence detected on an actin filament as shown in \\(B_{s}\\) which was fitted with two Gaussian distributions. The arrow shows the mean intensity of a single cofilin binding, and the arrowhead shows the mean noise level set to zero. The inset shows typical examples of treatment increases in cofilin fluorescence. The duration of the increase was measured at the half-maximum intensity level (dotted lines)._\n\n'
CAPTION FIG2.png: 'Figure 2: Kinetic analysis of the bending of collision to actin filaments. (A) Time-course of changes in cofilin fluorescence intensity. Arrows above the trace show the transient increase in cofilin fluorescence intensity. Bars above the time axis denote the duration of the transient increase in cofilin fluorescence intensity. Arrowheads show additional bindings. (B) Distribution of the duration of the transient fluorescence increases. The solid line represents the best fit to the experimental data with an exponential function (time constant, \\(1.17\\pm 0.09\\) \\(\\Downarrow\\) (C and D) The on-rata (C) and off-rata (D) of cofilin binding estimated at different concentrations of cofilin. The number of filaments examined is shown above the symbols. Bars denote the SEMs. *P \\(<\\) 0.05, one-way ANOVA.\n\n'
CAPTION FIG3.png: 'Figure 3: Imaging of the binding of cofilin to actin filaments with high spatial resolution. (A) An UAF-cofilin molecule acquired during 1 s of TIRF illumination; (a) a fluorescence image of a single cofilin binding, (b) a fluorescence image of two cofilin molecules 198 nm apart, and (c) the image of a cofilin that bound in addition to the first one (a). Image \\(\\epsilon\\) was generated by subtracting image a from image b. c and d show the intensity profile of the fluorescence spots in a and b, respectively. a shows the intensity profile of the subtracted image b-a. These profiles are fitted by Gaussian distributions. The position of the UAF-cofilin molecule is shown by the red arrow, and the additionally board UAF-cofilin is shown by the blue arrow. (B) An example of increases in a fluorescence intensity corresponding to initial and additional cofilin binding (a, red dotted line) and additional cofilin bindings (b, blue dotted line) (data in A and B are from different samples). The data acquisition area was a 600-ram-diameter circle. (C) Distribution of the distance between the intensity centroid of initial and additional cofilin bindings. Note that it decays from 23.6 to a basal positive level 2.0 (bin size, 40 nm). The inset shows the resolution of our recording system. We chose 35 nm for the pixel size as recommended (16), which provided \\(17.8\\pm 0.8\\) nm of resolution (shown by the arrowhead). Neither the value of the resolution nor the decay constant of cooperative binding was sensitive to the bin size chosen (30–50 nm for \\(C\\) and 15–30 nm for _I_band). See details in _SI Materials and Methods_.\n\n'
CAPTION FIG4.png: 'Figure 4: Analysis of the correlation between the on-rate of actin binding and fluctuations in the fluorescence intensity of actin filaments. (_A_) \\(A\\) TIRFM image of an actin filament tethered to a coverslip. (_B_) The kymograph of the time in \\(A\\). Note that the intensity of the actin fluorescence is normalized by the mean intensity (Materials and Methods). (_C_) The cellin binding number (red) and the index of fluctuation of the actin filament (blue) were plotted along the length of the actin filament. The intensity illuminated regions of the actin filament are shown by outlined arrows in \\(A\\) and \\(C\\), which corresponded to the regions with less index of fluctuator, shown by blue arrows in \\(C\\). The actin filament is presumably tethered at these sites. (_D_ and _E_) The relationship between the on-rate (_D_) and the off-rate (_E_) of actin bindings and the index of fluctuations (seven filaments were used for analysis; theoretical bar denotes the SEM). *P < 0.05, one-way ANOVA.\n\n'
